title: Alex Waislitz back's Wal King's Terracom coal play
text:
Billionaire Rich Lister Alex Waislitz is backing Wal King's coal play Terracom, emerging as a substantial shareholder in the junior miner.

Mr King, the former Leighton Holdings chief executive, is Terracom chairman, helping steer through the development of the Blair Athol mine in Queensland, which the company bought from Rio Tinto for the princely sum of $1 in 2017.

Mr Waislitz is riding the renaissance of the Australian coal industry. Prices for both coking and thermal coal have both more than doubled since the bottom of the market in early 2016.

Alex Waislitz has emerged as a substantial holder in Wal King's coal play. Arsineh Houspian

A substantial shareholder notice lodged with the Australian Securities Exchange on Thursday showed companies connected to Mr Waislitz owned 5.04 per cent of Terracom's shares.

Mr Waislitz isn't the only Rich Lister connected to Terracom's register. Adman John Singleton is the second biggest holder after his Bonython Coal led a $15 million underwriting earlier this year.
description: Billionaire Rich Lister Alex Waislitz is backing the miner at a time of resurgent coal prices.
